alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 25 at 10:31AM CDT until August 25 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Choctaw County in southwestern Alabama... Northwestern Washington County in southwestern Alabama... Wayne County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 130 PM CDT. * At 1031 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Waynesboro, Clara, Millry, Buckatunna, Winchester, Chicora, Denham, Belmont, Battles, Woodwards, Eret, Mehaffey, Boice, Contwell, Shady Grove, Aquilla, West King, Healing Springs, Dunbar and Barlow. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
